t: Luke 8
Many Women Support Christ’s Work
Afterward*p he was traveling from one town and village to another, preaching and telling the good news of the kingdom of God. The Twelve were with him,
and also some women who had been healed of evil spirits and sicknesses: Mary, called Magdalene (seven demons had come out of her);
Joanna the wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward; Susanna; and many others who were supporting them from their possessions.
The Parable of the Sower
As*p a large crowd was gathering, and people were coming to Jesus from every town, he said in a parable,
“A*r sower*r went*r out*r to*r sow*r his*r seed.*r As*r he*r sowed,*r some*r seed*r fell*r along*r the*r path;*r it*r was*r trampled*r on,*r and*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r sky*r devoured*r it.*r
Other*r seed*r fell*r on*r the*r rock;*r when*r it*r grew*r up,*r it*r withered*r away,*r since*r it*r lacked*r moisture.*r
Other*r seed*r fell*r among*r thorns;*r the*r thorns*r grew*r up*r with*r it*r and*r choked*r it.*r

Still*r other*r seed*r fell*r on*r good*r ground;*r when*r it*r grew*r up,*r it*r produced*r fruit:*r a*r hundred*r times*r what*r was*r sown.”*r As he said this, he called out, “Let*r anyone*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear*r listen.”*r
Why Jesus Used Parables
Then*p his disciples asked him, “What does this parable mean?”

So he said, “The*r secrets*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r have*r been*r given*r for*r you*r to*r know,*r but*r to*r the*r rest*r it*r is*r in*r parables,*r so*r that*r Looking*irpn they*ir may*ir not*ir see,*ir and*irln hearing*ir they*ir may*ir not*ir understand.*ir
The Parable of the Sower Explained
“This*rp is*r the*r meaning*r of*r the*r parable:*r The*r seed*r is*r the*r word*r of*r God.*r

The*r seed*r along*r the*r path*r are*r those*r who*r have*r heard*r and*r then*r the*r devil*r comes*r and*r takes*r away*r the*r word*r from*r their*r hearts,*r so*r that*r they*r may*r not*r believe*r and*r be*r saved.*r

And*r the*r seed*r on*r the*r rock*r are*r those*r who,*r when*r they*r hear,*r receive*r the*r word*r with*r joy.*r Having*r no*r root,*r these*r believe*r for*r a*r while*r and*r fall*r away*r in*r a*r time*r of*r testing.*r

As*r for*r the*r seed*r that*r fell*r among*r thorns,*r these*r are*r the*r ones*r who,*r when*r they*r have*r heard,*r go*r on*r their*r way*r and*r are*r choked*r with*r worries,*r riches,*r and*r pleasures*r of*r life,*r and*r produce*r no*r mature*r fruit.*r

But*r the*r seed*r in*r the*r good*r ground -*r these*r are*r the*r ones*r who,*r having*r heard*r the*r word*r with*r an*r honest*r and*r good*r heart,*r hold*r on*r to*r it*r and*r by*r enduring,*r produce*r fruit.*r
Using Your Light

“No*rp one,*r after*r lighting*r a*r lamp,*r covers*r it*r with*r a*r basket*r or*r puts*r it*r under*r a*r bed,*r but*r puts*r it*r on*r a*r lampstand*r so*r that*r those*r who*r come*r in*r may*r see*r its*r light.*r
For*r nothing*r is*r concealed*r that*r won’t*r be*r revealed,*r and*r nothing*r hidden*r that*r won’t*r be*r made*r known*r and*r brought*r to*r light.*r

Therefore*r take*r care*r how*r you*r listen.*r For*r whoever*r has,*r more*r will*r be*r given*r to*r him;*r and*r whoever*r does*r not*r have,*r even*r what*r he*r thinks*r he*r has*r will*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r him.”*r
True Relationships
Then*p his mother and brothers came to him, but they could not meet with him because of the crowd.
He was told, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”
But*p he replied to them, “My*r mother*r and*r my*r brothers*r are*r those*r who*r hear*r and*r do*r the*r word*r of*r God.”*r
Wind and Waves Obey Jesus
One*p day he and his disciples got into a boat, and he told them, “Let’s*r cross*r over*r to*r the*r other*r side*r of*r the*r lake.”*r So they set out,
and as they were sailing he fell asleep. Then a fierce windstorm came down on the lake; they were being swamped and were in danger.
They came and woke him up, saying, “Master, Master, we’re going to die!” Then*p he got up and rebuked the wind and the raging waves. So they ceased, and there was a calm.
He said to them, “Where*r is*r your*r faith?”*r They*p were fearful and amazed, asking one another, “Who then is this? He commands even the winds and the waves, and they obey him!”
Demons Driven Out by Jesus
Then*p they sailed to the region of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.
When he got out on land, a demon-possessed man from the town met him. For a long time he had worn no clothes and did not stay in a house but in the tombs.
When he saw Jesus, he cried out, fell down before him, and said in a loud voice, “What do you have to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torment me!”

For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. Many times it had seized him, and though he was guarded, bound by chains and shackles, he would snap the restraints and be driven by the demon into deserted places.
“What*rp is*r your*r name?”*r Jesus asked him. “Legion,”*p he said, because many demons had entered him.
And they begged him not to banish them to the abyss.
A*p large herd of pigs was there, feeding on the hillside. The demons begged him to permit them to enter the pigs, and he gave them permission.
The demons came out of the man and entered the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and drowned.
When*p the men who tended them saw what had happened, they ran off and reported it in the town and in the countryside.
Then people went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus and found the man the demons had departed from, sitting at Jesus’s feet, dressed and in his right mind. And they were afraid.
Meanwhile, the eyewitnesses reported to them how the demon-possessed man was delivered.
Then all the people of the Gerasene region asked him to leave them, because they were gripped by great fear. So getting into the boat, he returned.
The*p man from whom the demons had departed begged him earnestly to be with him. But he sent him away and said,
“Go*r back*r to*r your*r home,*r and*r tell*r all*r that*r God*r has*r done*r for*r you.”*r And off he went, proclaiming throughout the town how much Jesus had done for him.
A Girl Restored and a Woman Healed
When*p Jesus returned, the crowd welcomed him, for they were all expecting him.
Just then, a man named Jairus came. He was a leader of the synagogue. He fell down at Jesus’s feet and pleaded with him to come to his house,
because he had an only daughter about twelve years old, and she was dying. While*p he was going, the crowds were nearly crushing him.
A woman suffering from bleeding for twelve years, who had spent all she had on doctors and yet could not be healed by any,
approached from behind and touched the end of his robe. Instantly her bleeding stopped.
“Who*rp touched*r me?”*r Jesus asked. When*p they all denied it, Peter said, “Master, the crowds are hemming you in and pressing against you.”
“Someone*rp did*r touch*r me,”*r said Jesus. “I*r know*r that*r power*r has*r gone*r out*r from*r me.”*r

When the woman saw that she was discovered, she came trembling and fell down before him. In the presence of all the people, she declared the reason she had touched him and how she was instantly healed.
“Daughter,”*r he said to her, “your*r faith*r has*r saved*r you.*r Go*r in*r peace.”*r
While*p he was still speaking, someone came from the synagogue leader’s house and said, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t bother the teacher anymore.”
When*p Jesus heard it, he answered him, “Don’t*r be*r afraid.*r Only*r believe,*r and*r she*r will*r be*r saved.”*r
After he came to the house, he let no one enter with him except Peter, John, James, and the child’s father and mother.
Everyone was crying and mourning for her. But he said, “Stop*r crying,*r because*r she*r is*r not*r dead*r but*r asleep.”*r
They*p laughed at him, because they knew she was dead.
So he took her by the hand and called out, “Child,*r get*r up!”*r
Her spirit returned, and she got up at once. Then he gave orders that she be given something to eat.
Her parents were astounded, but he instructed them to tell no one what had happened.
